results.title: Families get angry
results.creator_credit: Delton Cook, John Simons and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A family quarrel begins when the father in a black, low-income family is trying to stretch too little money to pay too many bills. The two children are strongly affected by their parents’ conflict.

results.title: Families and life
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A letter to her family and future generations, Suzanne tells of her family history, especially of her father and husband in war and how Legacy helped her with her grief and loss and helped her to move forward with her life.

results.title: Families
results.creator_credit: Robin James, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras looks at the importance of family in Chinese culture, especially since the law restricted family size to one child in order to contain the population. Chinese Law since the 1950’s forbade polygamy and arranged marriages, and now young people can choose their own partners. The status of women and girls is discussed and the problems encountered raising single children. The program also looks at oracle bones and how these lead to the creation of written language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin James, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Familiar places (A)
results.creator_credit: David MacDougall and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Shows the recent movement of Aboriginal people back to their traditional lands. As this movement has grown Aborigines have seen the importance of mapping their land, and we see anthropologist Peter Sutton helping them. Peter Sutton provides a commentary on what he has learned about Aboriginal ties to the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David MacDougall and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies

results.title: Famiglia Martini
results.creator_credit: Franco Cavarra, Rosa Colosimo and Scopo Media Productions
results.brief_description: This tape consists of three Italian language programmes aimed at years 7 to 9. 1. “L’Incontro”. The younger members of the Martini famili go to the disco. 2.”Alla saluta”. Mr. Martini is encouraged by members of his family to go on a diet. 3.”La Partita a tennis”. Conflict occurs over who goes to tennis.

results.title: Famicom: Nintendo Family Computer HVC-001
results.material_description: Video game console with game controllers.  Includes original box with transformer, power cord and computer user manual. Object display only and not functioning
results.brief_description: Famicom Nintendo Family Computer HVC-001 video games console unit. Red and white plastic computer unit with two gaming controllers attached by black power cords. Controllers have ports designed to rest them either side of the unit. Console comes in original packaging (box) with RF switch, power cable and manual. The manual is written in foreign language

results.title: Fame
results.brief_description:
Fame is an American television series originally produced between 1982 and 1987. The show is based on the 1980 motion picture of the same name. Using a mixture of drama and music, it followed the lives of the students and faculty at the New York City High School for the Performing Arts. Although fictional, it was based heavily on the actual Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School of Music & Art and Performing Arts in New York. Most interior scenes were filmed in Hollywood, California. In all seasons except the 3rd, the show filmed several exterior scenes on location in New York City.

The popularity of the series, particularly in the UK, led to several hit records and live concert tours by the cast. Despite its success, very few of the actors maintained high-profile careers after the series was cancelled. A number of the cast members were seen again briefly in Bring Back…Fame, a reunion special made for UK television in 2008.

results.title: Fame
results.brief_description: A chronicle of the lives of several teenagers who attend a New York high school for students gifted in the performing arts.
results.description: A chronicle of the lives of several teenagers who attend a New York high school for students gifted in the performing arts.
description_for_label: A chronicle of the lives of several teenagers who attend a New York high school for students gifted in the performing arts.

results.title: Fame
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, David De Silva and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An energetic musical drama tracing the lives of eight talented teenagers who join Manhattan’s High School for the Performing Arts to train for show business careers. Follows their creative journey and emotional development from their painstaking audition day to their euphoric graduation performance four years later. The film is noted for its award winning soundtrack and the spontaneous dance sequence in the streets of New York during peak hour traffic. Cast includes: Irene Cara, Lee Curreri, Laura Dean, Antonia Franceschi, Boyd Gaines, Albert Hague, Tresa Hughes, Steve Inwood, Paul McCrane, Anne Meara, Joanna Merlin, Barry Miller, Jim Moody, Gene Anthony Ray and Maureen Teefy. Written by Christopher Gore. Original music by Michael Gore. (Awards: Academy Award 1980, Best Original Score)
